content:
• Wednesday, April 18, 2012
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) is now down 3.6% AH, paring losses after stating on its FQ2 earnings call...

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) is now down 3.6% AH, paring losses after stating on its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) its soft FQ3 chip guidance was the result of supply constraints for 28nm chips such as the MSM8960, albeit while admitting some customers are turning to rival chips to address the issue. Qualcomm also said it expects its FY12 royalty rate to be at the low end of a 3.4%-3.5% guidance range (perhaps due to Samsung's lower rate).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLB

    Core Laboratories (NYSE:CLB): Q1 EPS of $1.06 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $234M (+13.2% Y/Y)...

    Core Laboratories (NYSE:CLB): Q1 EPS of $1.06 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $234M (+13.2% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • FFIV

    More on F5's (NASDAQ:FFIV) FQ2: Company expects FQ3 revenue of $350M-$355M and EPS of...

    More on F5's (NASDAQ:FFIV) FQ2: Company expects FQ3 revenue of $350M-$355M and EPS of $1.12-$1.14, compared with a consensus of $353.1M and $1.14. Strong demand is seen for both mid-range VIPRION 2400 switch and high-end VIPRION 4400. 404K shares repurchased during quarter. In spite of the in-line guidance, F5 is now up 5.9% AH, suggesting recent worries were more than baked in. (PR) (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • MAR

    Marriott International (NYSE:MAR): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $2.5B (-8.1% Y/Y)...

    Marriott International (NYSE:MAR): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $2.5B (-8.1% Y/Y) misses by $110M. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • EBAY

    More on eBay's Q1: Company expects Q2 revenue of $3.25B-$3.35B and EPS of $0.53-$0.55, compared...

    More on eBay's Q1: Company expects Q2 revenue of $3.25B-$3.35B and EPS of $0.53-$0.55, compared with consensus of $3.36B and $0.54. 2012 guidance is more solid: revenue of $13.8B-$14.1B and EPS of $2.30-$2.35 vs. consensus of $13.85B and $2.30. Q1 PayPal revenue +32% Y/Y, active accounts +12% to 109.8M, payment volume +24% to $33.9B. Marketplaces revenue +11% Y/Y to $1.73B. $240M worth of shares repurchased. EBAY +5.4% Y/Y. (PR) (CC webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM): Q1 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $367M (+6.8% Y/Y) misses by $4M....

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM): Q1 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $367M (+6.8% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • SWK

    Stanley Works (NYSE:SWK): Q1 EPS of $1.09 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $2.65B (+12.3% Y/Y)...

    Stanley Works (NYSE:SWK): Q1 EPS of $1.09 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $2.65B (+12.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX): Q1 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $88.7M (+61%...

    Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX): Q1 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $88.7M (+61% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +9.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ2 EPS of $1.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $339.6M (+22.3% Y/Y)...

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ2 EPS of $1.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $339.6M (+22.3% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares -4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM): Q1 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.74B (+13% Y/Y) in-line....

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM): Q1 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.74B (+13% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $3.3B (+29% Y/Y) beats by $150M....

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $3.3B (+29% Y/Y) beats by $150M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • QCOM

    More on Qualcomm's FQ2: Baseband chip shipments rose 29% Y/Y to 152M, but company expects only...

    More on Qualcomm's FQ2: Baseband chip shipments rose 29% Y/Y to 152M, but company expects only 144M-152M in FQ3 (could share loss be an issue?). Collected royalties on 239M-243M devices at an average price of $211-$217 ($212-$218 in FQ1). This leads Qualcomm to hike its FY12 ASP guidance to $207-$217 from $204-$216. R&D expenses rose 30% Y/Y to $824M. Ended FQ2 with $26.6B in cash and investments ($22B prior). QCOM -6.6% AH. (PR) (CC webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 4 Comments
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST): Q1 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $211M (+30% Y/Y)...

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST): Q1 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $211M (+30% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ2 EPS of $1.01 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $4.94B (+28% Y/Y) beats by...

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ2 EPS of $1.01 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $4.94B (+28% Y/Y) beats by $100M. Expects FQ3 revenue of $4.45B-$4.85B and EPS of $0.83-$0.89, largely below consensus of $4.8B and $0.90. Expects FY12 revenue of $18.7B-$19.7B and EPS of $3.61-$3.76, compared with consensus of $19.4B and $3.77. Shares -6.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q1 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $1.06B (+25% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q1 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $1.06B (+25% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • AMG

    Affiliated Managers Group (AMG +2.2%), which already owns stakes in more than two dozen money...

    Affiliated Managers Group (AMG +2.2%), which already owns stakes in more than two dozen money managers, will acquire a majority interest in Yacktman Asset Management, an investment manager with ~$17B in assets under management.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • ARNA

    Another round of losses for Arena Pharma (ARNA -15.2%), as Adam Feuerstein responds to critics...

    Another round of losses for Arena Pharma (ARNA -15.2%), as Adam Feuerstein responds to critics of his view that its weight-loss drug "isn't much more than a placebo" and causes tumors in rats. Lorcaserin is "a weight loss drug that doesn't really help obese people lose weight, but which may exacerbate heart valve problems or fuel the growth of tumors. Not exactly the best risk-benefit equation."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 9 Comments
  • AABA

    Analysts are mostly impressed with new Yahoo CEO (YHOO +3%) Scott Thompson and raise their 2012...

    Analysts are mostly impressed with new Yahoo CEO (YHOO +3%) Scott Thompson and raise their 2012 EPS and revenue estimates. But Pacific Crest's Evan Wilson cuts shares to Sector Perform, lacking confidence YHOO will unlock the full value of its Asian assets and unconvinced Thompson's strategy will lead to meaningfully better results over the next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • IBM

    Macquarie's Brad Zelnick is cutting IBM (IBM -3.2%) to Neutral in the wake of its Q1 report,...

    Macquarie's Brad Zelnick is cutting IBM (IBM -3.2%) to Neutral in the wake of its Q1 report, though he's also boosting his PT to $215 and calling the downgrade valuation-related (IBM's consensus 2012 P/E of 14.4 is above its peer group's 12.7). Zelnick considers Oracle (ORCL -0.3%) a better enterprise IT play, and expects the company's May quarter results to reflect seasonal strength. (more on IBM)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • LQMT

    Microcap Liquidmetal Technologies (OTCQB:LQMT +32%) soars on a rumor from Korea IT News that the...

    Microcap Liquidmetal Technologies (OTCQB:LQMT +32%) soars on a rumor from Korea IT News that the next iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) will make use of "liquid metal." However, AppleInsider is skeptical of the report given it also claims the next iPhone is expected to be announced in June instead of this fall. Liquidmetal, which sold Apple exclusive rights to a metal alloy in 2010, jumped in March on hopes of iPad-related sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • GOGL

    Knightsbridge Tankers (VLCCF -5.1%) skids on a downgrade to Equal Weight at Evercore, citing...

    Knightsbridge Tankers (VLCCF -5.1%) skids on a downgrade to Equal Weight at Evercore, citing cash flow risk and a likely dividend cut due to the shipper's heavy spot market exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • CREE

    Cree's (CREE -5.9%) FQ3 miss and soft FQ4 guidance is unsurprisingly bringing down other LED...

    Cree's (CREE -5.9%) FQ3 miss and soft FQ4 guidance is unsurprisingly bringing down other LED industry firms. RBCN -3.3%. LEDS -1.8%. AIXG -2.6%. ThinkEquity has responded to the news by downgrading Cree to Hold. Staying bullish is Oppenheimer, which thinks sales disruptions caused by the Rund acquisition are causing short-term problems. Needham and Jefferies expect Cree's margins to expand as business recovers. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -4.7%) agrees to buy certain Williston Basin oil and gas properties from...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -4.7%) agrees to buy certain Williston Basin oil and gas properties from Baytex Energy (BTE -0.4%) for ~$311M, giving it greater exposure in one of North Dakota's most active shale resource plays. MHR plans to increase its upstream capex budget by $75M-$225M, mostly to account for expected additional spending for the acquired properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 4 Comments
  • CTCM

    Russian broadcaster CTC Media (CTCM -1.4%) slips after JP Morgan cuts its rating on the shares...

    Russian broadcaster CTC Media (CTCM -1.4%) slips after JP Morgan cuts its rating on the shares to Underweight, citing increased competition and a declining audience share count at its flagship channel.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +5.9%) shares move higher in tandem with rival Seagate (STX +5.3%), whose...

    Western Digital (WDC +5.9%) shares move higher in tandem with rival Seagate (STX +5.3%), whose FQ3 earnings surged for a second straight quarter as it enjoyed pent-up demand and higher prices for hard drives. But as margins fall as production levels return to normal following Thailand's floods, investors' easy money in these stocks may have passed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • YPF

    YPF resumes trading, -21.5% after a near 2-day halt following Argentina's move to nationalize...

    YPF resumes trading, -21.5% after a near 2-day halt following Argentina's move to nationalize the company. They had already fallen about 14% in the time between the nationalization news and the trading stoppage. Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY) -6.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain (GMCR -3.2%) slips on cautious comments out of Stifel Nicolaus this morning,...

    Green Mountain (GMCR -3.2%) slips on cautious comments out of Stifel Nicolaus this morning, saying K-Cup sales growth is decelerating and the company is facing increased competition from a number of other brands. After conducting channel checks, the firm says the coffee maker is losing "material" shelf space in stores, while some stores are discounting its best selling brands by nearly 25%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • TEX

    A day after scoring a nifty 5.9% gain inspired by a Wells Fargo upgrade, shares of Terex (TEX...

    A day after scoring a nifty 5.9% gain inspired by a Wells Fargo upgrade, shares of Terex (TEX +3.8%) ride higher again. Morningstar says that despite sizable exposure to Western Europe, the company's prospects are sound and a "decent" margin of safety for investors exists.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • IBM

    Though IBM's (IBM -2.4%) Q1 report wasn't as strong as Goldman expected, the firm says its Buy...

    Though IBM's (IBM -2.4%) Q1 report wasn't as strong as Goldman expected, the firm says its Buy thesis is intact, given ongoing profit growth in software and services. Less positive is BMO (Market Perform), which points out EPS was boosted by a low tax rate, and revenue growth may have been negative without acquisitions. Nonetheless, the firm expects IBM to hit its 2015 EPS target of $20 thanks to margin improvements. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • TXT

    Shares of Textron (TXT -3.6%) abruptly reverse course what appears to be a bout of...

    Shares of Textron (TXT -3.6%) abruptly reverse course what appears to be a bout of profit-taking, erasing nearly a 4% gain in the pre-opening session after a solid Q1 earnings beat. The stock has significantly outperformed this year, gaining over 29% since just the beginning of January.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • HBAN

    Huntington Bancshares (HBAN +4.1%) unloads a torrent of information on an earnings CC, saying...

    Huntington Bancshares (HBAN +4.1%) unloads a torrent of information on an earnings CC, saying that it seeks acquisition targets of $500M-$2.5B in size and is evaluating dividend and stock buyback options. The company will also unveil a new credit card product in 2013. (Earlier: earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +8.8%) is the S&P 500's top gainer after its Q1 earnings beat...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +8.8%) is the S&P 500's top gainer after its Q1 earnings beat yesterday and guidance that topped Street forecasts, prompting analysts to increase their price targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 5 Comments
  • DNB

    Dun & Bradstreet (DNB -3.5%) shoots lower after JPMorgan chimes in with a dour Underweight...

    Dun & Bradstreet (DNB -3.5%) shoots lower after JPMorgan chimes in with a dour Underweight rating. It's not a valuation or price performance call from JP that rules the day, but rather concerns over 2012 revenue growth have the attention of analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • FSLR

    Merrill joins Cantor Fitzgerald in upgrading First Solar (FSLR -3%). Though it still expects...

    Merrill joins Cantor Fitzgerald in upgrading First Solar (FSLR -3%). Though it still expects First Solar's earnings to decline over the next several years (!), and sees ongoing price pressure from Chinese rivals, it's pleased the company is getting rid of excess capacity, and likes its low valuation. However, Wunderlich is downgrading shares to Sell, predicting continued share loss due to the inadequacy of First Solar's panels for space-constrained deployments.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 4 Comments
  • CTRX

    Shares of SXC Health Solutions (SXCI +7.1%) trade higher following the announcement that it will...

    Shares of SXC Health Solutions (SXCI +7.1%) trade higher following the announcement that it will buy fellow PBM-player Catalyst Health Solutions for $4.4B in cash and stock. The deal will close in H2 of this year and start to kick in to SXCI's adjusted earnings in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • PII

    Polaris Industries (PII +6.5%) gets a pop after its Q1 easily beats estimates this morning. Net...

    Polaris Industries (PII +6.5%) gets a pop after its Q1 easily beats estimates this morning. Net earnings jumped 27% Y/Y on strong sales of off-road vehicles, its largest top-line contributor, and growing revenue from snowmobiles and motorcycles, including its Victory brand. The company also raises FY guidance to between $3.85 - $4.00 per share. Separately, Wells Fargo upgrades the stock to Outperform on the back of the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • WYNN

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (WYNN +5.5%) power higher on a report the Macau government may sign the...

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (WYNN +5.5%) power higher on a report the Macau government may sign the land grant contract for the gaming operator’s projected Cotai property within this month. Wynn is expected to report a strong Q1 after Thursday's close, with consensus EPS estimated at $1.41.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • INTC

    RBC (Outperform) isn't bothered by the ho-hum guidance attached to Intel's (INTC -2.4%) Q1...

    RBC (Outperform) isn't bothered by the ho-hum guidance attached to Intel's (INTC -2.4%) Q1 report: the firm argues ultrabook demand, emerging markets sales, and server CPU strength will translate into 2013 EPS of $3, well above a consensus of $2.63. Wedbush (Neutral), however, thinks good news is fully priced in, and expects shares to be range-bound until there's better visibility on ultrabook adoption. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • ATRS

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS -3.4%) trade lower on above-average trading volume. SA author...

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS -3.4%) trade lower on above-average trading volume. SA author James Stocklasar Thomas warns that the company may hit a speed bump with its Q1 and Q2 results. "Antares is growing, but it is not firing on all cylinders."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • MJN

    Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -2.6%) and Danone (OTCQX:DANOY) look like the losers for Pfizer's...

    Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -2.6%) and Danone (OTCQX:DANOY) look like the losers for Pfizer's (PFE +0.5%) baby formula business, as PFE reportedly is near a deal to sell the unit to Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY) for at least $9B. MJN and Danone were said to have teamed up for a bid that may have been as high as $10B.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • KNOL

    Shares of Knology (NASDAQ:KNOL) come off of a trading halt to roar 7.4% higher after the tech...

    Shares of Knology (NASDAQ:KNOL) come off of a trading halt to roar 7.4% higher after the tech concern is snapped up by privately-owned peer WOW!.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • BRK.A

    Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A -1%, (BRK.B -0.9%) shares open lower on the revelation that Warren...

    Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A -1%, (BRK.B -0.9%) shares open lower on the revelation that Warren Buffett has been diagnosed with Stage 1 prostate cancer. Buffett tells CNBC nothing has changed in the company's succession plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • KNOL

    Knology (NASDAQ:KNOL), a cable operator serving markets in the South and Midwest, is being...

    Knology (NASDAQ:KNOL), a cable operator serving markets in the South and Midwest, is being acquired by privately-owned peer WOW! for $19.75 in cash. The transaction price amounts to $1.5B after accounting for Knology's debt. WOW!'s offer represents just a 9.4% premium to Knology's Tuesday close, but shares had already rallied on M&A hopes. Knology is currently halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • BK

    BNY Mellon (NYSE:BK) -1.5% after reporting Q1 earnings that were in line, with net profit...

    BNY Mellon (NYSE:BK) -1.5% after reporting Q1 earnings that were in line, with net profit slipping 1% to $619M as forex revenue plunged 21% Y/Y. BNY declares divdend of $0.13 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • RHHBY

    Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) says it will not extend its latest tender offer for Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN):...

    Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) says it will not extend its latest tender offer for Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): "We do not believe that a price above Roche's offer for Illumina of $51/share would be in the interest of Roche's shareholders." ILMN -7.5% at the open.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (NYSE:HDY) +7.7% premarket after saying it has engaged BofA Merrill Lynch to...

    Hyperdynamics (NYSE:HDY) +7.7% premarket after saying it has engaged BofA Merrill Lynch to assist in a potential sale of a portion of its 77% interest in its 25K sq. km oil and gas exploration concession offshore Guinea in West Africa. HDY wants to farm out half its interest to an experienced oil and gas firm that also would serve as operator of the project.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower premarket, weighed down by falls in Intel (-2.7%)...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower premarket, weighed down by falls in Intel (-2.7%) and IBM (-2.2%) following earnings and matching the direction in Europe as the debt crises in Spain, Portugal and Italy rumble on. S&P benchmark futures -0.4%. SXC Health +9.4% and Catalyst +33% after the two agree to merge. Later: eBay, American Express earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • TRQ

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN) founder Robert Friedland resigns as CEO and as a director as part of a...

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN) founder Robert Friedland resigns as CEO and as a director as part of a sweeping agreement with majority shareholder Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) that ensures RIO's support for continued funding of IVN's Oyu Tolgoi mining project in Mongolia. The move ends a long battle between Friedland and RIO over control of the company. IVN +9.5%, RIO +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • CHSI

    Premarket gainers: CHSI +32%. SXCI +9%. IVN +9%. URI +9%. HDY +4%. WYNN +4%. FSLR +3%. PCX +3%....

    Premarket gainers: CHSI +32%. SXCI +9%. IVN +9%. URI +9%. HDY +4%. WYNN +4%. FSLR +3%. PCX +3%. WLT +3%. STX +3%.
    Losers: GNW -11%. CREE -7%. ALU -5%. STD -4%. TEF -4%. SYT -3%. BEE -3%. ASML -3%. CHK -3%. UBS -3%. SNE -3%. LOGI -3%. INTC -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) knocks out a 3.1% gain premarket after the firm lands an upgrade...

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) knocks out a 3.1% gain premarket after the firm lands an upgrade from Sterne Agee to Neutral from Underperform on a valuation call. Shares have fallen off 37.7% over six months of trading action - a good chunk of it tied to a Q1 guidance cut.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • GNW

    Genworth Financial (NYSE:GNW) delays the planned minority IPO of up to 40% of its Australian...

    Genworth Financial (NYSE:GNW) delays the planned minority IPO of up to 40% of its Australian mortgage insurance business. Shares -11.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • ASRT

    DepoMed (DEPO) +6.7% premarket after saying it will prepare and file a new drug application with...

    DepoMed (DEPO) +6.7% premarket after saying it will prepare and file a new drug application with the FDA in H2 2012 for its Serada treatment for menopausal hot flashes. Results of three Phase 3 clinical trials were positive and statistically significant for three of the four pre-specified primary endpoints.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • TXT

    Shares of Textron (NYSE:TXT) +4% in premarket action after the firm beat the estimates of...

    Shares of Textron (NYSE:TXT) +4% in premarket action after the firm beat the estimates of analysts on both lines of its Q1 report. Strong demand for Cessna aircraft and Bell helicopters - unhinged by corporate buyers and emerging markets - led the revenue gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • THQIQ

    Videogame maker THQ (THQI) +40% premarket after raising its FQ4 outlook due to strong sales of...

    Videogame maker THQ (THQI) +40% premarket after raising its FQ4 outlook due to strong sales of its Saints Row: The Third game. Expected EPS loss is now $0.10-$0.20 vs. consensus loss of $0.40, on revenue of $160M-$170M vs. $142.3M consensus. THQ expects to report cash and cash equivalents of ~$76M, three times higher than its previous estimate.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) and McClendon aficionados will surely remember 2008, when the CEO...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) and McClendon aficionados will surely remember 2008, when the CEO and the company nearly went down after he received margin calls on loans he had taken out to purchase stock in the company. A stake worth $1.9B at one point mostly vanished. (today's borrowing story)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 22 Comments
  • FSLR

    Cantor Fitzgerald upgrades First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) to Hold from Sell with a price target of...

    Cantor Fitzgerald upgrades First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) to Hold from Sell with a price target of $21.50, saying solar prices have collapsed below their bearish estimates. Analyst Dale Pfau says the next phase in the sector will be "irrational consolidation" that will throw fundamentals out the window in favor of politics, M&A activity, and "perhaps luck." Shares -2.0% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 1 Comment

  • EU shares are mixed in morning trading, while Italian and Spanish 10-year debt yields are again...

    EU shares are mixed in morning trading, while Italian and Spanish 10-year debt yields are again falling sharply despite Italy saying it will miss its budget deficit targets and frankness from Portugal's prime minister. Euro STOXX 50 -0.7%, London +0.1%, Paris -0.7%, Frankfurt -0.2%. Spanish yields -16 bps at 5.72%, Italy -8 pbs at 5.39%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 AM | 1 Comment
